{"step_by_step_thinking": "Calculus is a hard deposit that forms on the tooth surface due to the mineralization of dental plaque. Altered cementum refers to changes in the cementum layer of the tooth, which can occur due to various factors such as inflammation or trauma. The portion of the tooth covered by calculus or altered cementum is referred to as the deposit zone.", "answer_choice": "B. Deposit zone"}
